"There's a whole bunch of software companies whose stock prices are under a lot of pressure because somehow AI is going to replace them," Huang said.

news.headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Says It's 'Illogical' to Think AI Will Replace Software Tools
news.summary: Worries about artificial intelligence disrupting the software business are overblown, Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang said.  "There's this notion that the software industry is in decline and will be replaced by AI," Huang said late Tuesday at an event hosted by Cisco, hours after a selloff in U.S. software stocks.  "There's a whole bunch of software companies whose stock prices are under a lot of pressure because somehow AI is going to replace them," Huang said.

news.headline: Private payroll growth in January misses expectations as market awaits official jobs data
news.article_text:
US private employers added fewer positions than anticipated last month, according to the private payroll processor ADP, starting 2026 off on a downbeat note.

Shaw believes CoStar’s shares have underperformed because of its “high-risk, money-losing” investment in Homes.com, a consumer-facing platform that aggregates home listings, according to a letter to CoStar’s board of directors that D.E. Shaw made public Wednesday.  D.E. Shaw says a change of leadership is needed to address CoStar’s underperformance, according to the letter, which was earlier reported by The Wall Street Journal.

news.article_text:
By Danilo Masoni

Feb 4 (Reuters) - U.S. software stocks extended their slide on Wednesday, driven by fears of disruption caused by artificial intelligence, with some analysts warning of more volatility as investors assess whether the challenge is existential for the sector.

The selloff was triggered by a new legal tool from Anthropic, which showed the ​AI industry's growing push into industries that can unlock lucrative enterprise revenue needed to fund massive investments in the technology.

news.headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Says It's 'Illogical' to Think AI Will Replace Software Tools

"There's a whole bunch of software companies whose stock prices are under a lot of pressure because somehow AI is going to replace them," Huang said.
